scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. Now, [Monica] frowns slightly and [Bob] raises an eyebrow. [Bob] remarks, 'Well, if everyone just starts saying no to extra work, won't that leave us in a bind during real emergencies?' You agreed with Bob, conceding that you should have thought about the long-term implications. Monica crosses her arms and Bob looks contemplative, as you all continue the discussion.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs and says, 'So how do we find a balance then, [Alex]? We can't always rely on the same few people for emergencies.'

options.text: Maybe we need to implement a rotation system, so the responsibility is shared more evenly.
options.analysis: You propose a practical solution, showing good self-regulation and social skills while acknowledging the issue.

options.text: I see what you're saying, Monica. Perhaps we should discuss this more in our next team meeting.
options.analysis: You suggest deferring the discussion, showing empathy and emotional perception but lower motivation and social skills.

options.text: If we can't manage emergencies without burning out, then maybe we're understaffed.
options.analysis: You take a critical stance, highlighting a potential structural issue, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
